learning_outcomes.description: Understand the application of academic learning in your specialist Field of Study to a real-life work situation.
Explain how the theory of your Field of Study can be successfully utilised in enhancing practical field applications.
Draft project documentation which is logical, coherent and relevant to clientele needs and expectations, as well as the interests and requirements of potential funding agencies.
Display an understanding of the modus operandi of a not-for-profit, commercial, government or other relevant organisation involved in strategic communication, social change or other relevant field.
Display enhanced skills in working with individuals and teams in diverse offices and/or field environments.

assessments.due_date: To be submitted within 2 days after starting with the host organisation by 4pm on the relevant date.
assessments.task_description:
Prepare a workplan providing brief information about the host organisation and/or project to be involved in and describing the tasks to be undertaken during the practicum. For each task the expected outcomes for the host organisation, the learning objectives for the student, and timing should be elaborated.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Machine Translation (MT) may support students in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of MT in each instance. A failure to reference MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
22/05/2026 4:00 pm

Presentation: In person in class in Week 12.

Report: Submitted by 4pm Friday of Week 12.
assessments.task_description:
The final report should outline the student's activities and achievements in the industry operational environment and a reflection on the experience:

  • overview of the organisation/agency in which the practicum experience was achieved;
  • description of the tasks undertaken and reflection onf how challenges were dealt with;
  • outcomes achieved for the host organisation, including examples attached to the report as annexes;
  • reflection on achievement of the learning objectives; and
  • reflection on the overall experience and lessons learned, including successes/failures noted by the student.

This is submitted at the completion of the placement in conjunction with a short oral presentation (10 minutes) to class in Week 12.

Recording of Oral and Practical Assessment 

  • All presentations will be recorded for marking purposes via recording facilities available where the assessment takes place (eg. ECHO360, Zoom, camera device)  
  • Recordings will be retained by the School of Communication and Arts for at least 12 months from the release of the final grade for the course.  
  • Recordings will be stored in a secure manner and will only be accessed by authorised school staff for the purposes of:
  • Moderation of marking;  
  • Provision of feedback to the student(s) recorded; and/or  
  • Re-marking following a successful re-mark application

learning_activities.topic:
Week 1: Introductory Session

Introduction to the Industry Placement. This week, students will work with the Course Coordinator and Course Administrator to discuss, plan, and finalise their field-specific tasks for their host organisation, including the actual start/finish dates/times, number of hours of work, type of organisation, supervision arrangements, risk assessment, etc.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02

learning_activities.topic:
Week 2: In-class workshop and activities

Students will continue to finalise their placement plans, plus undertake in-class and online activities that are intended to assist in the placement as well as the future career market.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05

learning_activities.topic:
Week 10: Employability Workshop 1

Two workshops will be conducted face-to-face by UQs Employability and Careers team, facilitated by the Course Coordinator. These will consider relevant topics such as networking for jobs, applying directly for jobs, applications, CVs, pitch letters, and responding to criteria-based positions.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05

Week 12: Presentations and Evaluation

Students will share and reflect on their experiences in the meeting weeks - weeks 1, 2, 4, 5 and 12. Week 12 will be an oral presentation based on the final reflection, highlighting key learnings (5-10 minutes).
